32 36 row heel turn with ws facing you turn the heel as follows set up row 1 ws sl1 p14 16 18 p2tog p1 turn set up row 2 rs sl1 k3 ssk k1 turn row 1 ws sl1 purl to 1 stitch before gap p2tog p1 turn row 2 rs sl1 knit to 1 stitch before gap ssk k1 turn repeat row 1 & 2 until all stitches have been worked and 16 18 20 stitches remain #disturbanceintheforcesocks page 7 of 12 marie-elyse dugal designs gusset set-up using the needle holding the flap stitches pick up pu and knit the 14 16 18 slipped stitches for the first side of the flap pu one additional stitch in the space between the side of the flap and the instep remove bor marker work round 3 of the pattern or whatever other round of the force flowing motif you were at when reaching the leg length you wanted on the instep stitches using the other needle once again using the heel needle pu a stitch between the instep and the second side of the flap pu and knit the 14 16 18 slipped stitches on that side of the flap knit 8 9 10 stitches and place bor marker in its new position in the centre of the flap *notice that on one needle will be all the flap and sides of the flap stitches which will become the underside of the foot and on the other needle will be the instep stitches now begin the gusset decreases set-up round knit to last 2 stitches on heel needle ssk work the instep following the pattern you should be on round 4 at this stage if following the pattern suggestions switch to heel needle k2tog knit to end of round 2 stitches decreased round 1 knit to last 3 stitches k2tog k1 work instep stitches in pattern k1 ssk knit to end of round 2 stitches decreased round 2 knit to end of sole side needle work instep stitches in pattern knit to end of round repeat rounds 1 & 2 until 28 32 36 stitches remain on heel needle for a total of 56 64 72 stitches per round as in the beginning #disturbanceintheforcesocks page 8 of 12 marie-elyse dugal designs foot keep working instep stitches following the pattern and
